result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Ammon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua J. Ammon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua J. Ammon was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any previously imposed sentences.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
++ Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. Do not reside with any person in any place in which children reside unless you are related to them by blood.  **Not to reside with anyone of the opposite sex without court's permission.  May Not have contact with victim or be on the premises of the PLS Store.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge against the deft.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J. Ammon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: For Ct 2 only - Dismissed.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
placed on probation

Minutes:  15CF767/15CF1038.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Laura Walker.  Victim rights compliance.  Court requested copy of JV paperwork prior to today's hrg; however, the request was not answered.  Court proceeds today with the sentencing hrg.  Sentencing arguments made. 

15CF767 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 3yrs on count 2 & 2yrs on count 7 concurrent.  See conditions.

15CF1038 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 3yrs concurrent to 15CF767.  See conditions.

NOTE - probation sentences are concurrent to each other but consecutive to any previously imposed sentences.
Appeal rights
Firearm waring
Voting acknowledgment
DNA ordered; written notice given to deft
Email sent to Judge Rossell requesting to obtain a copy of the deft's petition and dispo order from his JV file

Minutes:  15CF767/15CF1038.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Laura Walker.  Oral corrections made to PSI by defense counsel.  Court questioned the deft briefly on the JV conviction.  Court sets the sentencing hrg over to 11/10/16 @ 10am in order to request a copy of the petition and dispo order from the deft's JV file.

Minutes:  15CF767/15CF1038.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Laura Walker.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  

15CF767 - deft pleads guilty to counts 2 & 7; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

15CF1038 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining count dismissed on State's motion.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 9/21/16 @ 1:30pm.
from deft requesting the court disregard his previous letter in which he asked for an adjournment and different counsel
from deft requesting an adjournment of his JS date and new counsel; copy of letter sent to attys

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Laura Walker appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft was sent from the RCJ to Dodge Correctional.  State was unaware of the transport to Dodge Correctional  JS adj to 8/15/16 @ 9am.  Parties to notify the court by 5pm on the Wednesday prior to trial.
And demand for discovery - filed by Atty J Krejcarek.
JS adjourned on request of defense counsel with no objection ADA Krejcarek
Jury selection on May 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Minutes:  15CF767/15CF1038.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Laura Walker appeared on behalf of deft.  Deft not transported from RCJ.  Mutual request to leave cases on for JS for 4/11/16 and wait to conduct ludwig on the day of trial.  Court grants the request.

Minutes:  15CF767/15CF1038.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Laura Walker.  Mutual request for an adjournment of the trial date.  ADA Krejcarek reports the download of the text messages have been received.  However, the deft was on probation and he was revoked.  During the revocation hrg, the complaining witness in this case testified and possibly recanted much of her statement.  ADA Krejcarek reports she contacted DOC to obtain a transcript of the proceedings.  Defense concurs with adjournment request.  FPT adj to 3/17/16 @ 11am, JS 4/11/16 @ 9am

Minutes:  15CF767/15CF1038.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody.  Atty Laura Walker appeared via telephone (telephone appearance was approved since she has the flu).  Discussion ensues re: phone/text messages.  FPT set for 1/28/16 @ 1:15pm.  Court suggests the State or Defense issue a subpoena for the phone.  Parties shall appear at the next hrg with either the phone or the text messages.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Laura Walker.  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 3.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered.  FPT 1/5/16 @ 1:30pm.  JS 2/8/16 @ 9am along w/15CF767.

Attorney Laura Ann Walker appeared.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:   DE was not brought by WRIT for this hearing.   DE does have another hearing in Br 3 on 15CF767 at 1:15pm today.   When DE is brought by WRIT for that hearing the preliminary hearing will be held in this file either in Br 3 or in Intake immediately following Br 3 hearing.
per request of Atty Walker and approval of Atty Burgoyne, prelim hearing rescheduled from 11-20-15 to 11-19-15 at 10:15am Intake.
Atty:  L Walker.

*No Contact w/ HB (5/18/87) or her residence.

151pm  Special Prosecutor Attorney Daniel Tombasco  appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Laura Walker.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on November 20, 2015 at 08:45 am.  $10,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Deft waives time limits.  kmk
